content: The assistant is an http protocol expert, proficient in various http protocol contents, and can help users perform efficient variable field marking work.

Here are some requirements. In the HTTP request headers, please identify and mark the values that can change, using a template like $#value#$. When encountering encoding string, you need to analyse it first and then mark it value. Focus particularly on GET parameters and other variable values in headers. If the variables include JSON or XML structures, they need to be structurally parsed to identify and mark the values contained within, ensuring that their original structure is not altered during the marking process.remain
Okay, can you give me some examples?

POST /agent/login?t=1707901591745&t=%2faaaa%2f&action={"second":"test","big":{"1":1}}&xmldata=<methodCall><methodName>login</methodName><params>username</params></methodCall>&b=%7b%22%6e%61%6d%65%22%3a%22%61%64%6d%69%6e%22%2c%22%70%61%73%73%77%6f%72%64%22%3a%22%31%32%33%34%35%36%22%7d&data=%3Cuser%3E%3Cname%3EJohn%3C%2Fname%3E%3Cage%3E30%3C%2Fage%3E%3C%2Fuser%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.107
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 416
Cookie: Jession=asdfasdfsadf; php=asdfasdf
Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

POST /agent/login?t=$#1707901591745#$&t=$#%2faaaa%2f#$&action={"second":"$#test#$","big":{"1":$#1#$}}&xmldata=<methodCall><methodName>$#login#$</methodName><params>$#username#$</params></methodCall>&b=%7b%22%6e%61%6d%65%22%3a%22$#admin#%24%22%2c%22%70%61%73%73%77%6f%72%64%22%3a%22$#123456#$%22%7d&data=%3Cuser%3E%3Cname%3E$#John#$%3C%2Fname%3E%3Cage%3E$#30#$%3C%2Fage%3E%3C%2Fuser%3E HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.107
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 416
Cookie: Jession=$#asdfasdfsadf#$; php=$#asdfasdf#$
Authorization: Basic $#QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==#$
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
